Today, Dan and Jordan dip back to the past to discuss how Alex reports on stories ranging from wildfires to Mexican troops kidnapping American familes.

==Detailed Show Notes==

Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/12/11/episode-756-december-5-2003 Episode #756: December 5, 2003]</ref>:

*People [https://allnurses-breakroom.com/mother-places-month-old-infant-t12620/ put children] [https://www.deseret.com/2000/11/2/19536973/mom-who-put-son-in-dryer-is-sentenced in dryers] more than one would like to know
*Report on the [https://web.archive.org/web/20090601105532/https://www.fire.ca.gov/fire_protection/downloads/2003FireStoryInternet.pdf 2003 California fires] ([https://www.cbsnews.com/news/california-wildfires-lessons-from-2003-cooling-temps-possible-arson/ other info])
*[https://www.sandiego.gov/fire/about/majorfires/2003cedar The Cedar fire]
*The Old Fire arsonist was [https://www.corrections1.com/archive/articles/arsonist-gets-death-for-calif-fire-that-killed-5-KHLaBvM0DthMjMgL/ sentenced to death]
*[https://www.airandspaceforces.com/article/0613angel/ Angel Thunder]
*[https://www.newsmax.com/pre-2008/mexican-troops-kidnap-texas/2003/12/03/id/677685/ Newsmax article] about Mexican troops kidnapping a Texas family
*Robert Maupin was apparently kidnapped by Mexican troops in [https://books.google.com/books?dq=%22Robert%20Maupin%22%20border&hl=en&id=xCPeNSy6Fm4C&lpg=PA122&ots=OzQg_Cg3FR&pg=PA122&sa=X&sig=ACfU3U3_hn-Mj9OWrrl_gxFfmkZAAOvIFA&source=bl&ved=2ahUKEwi-ivWQ_fD7AhVWrHIEHcM0Bas4HhDoAXoECBoQAw#v=onepage&q=%22Robert%20Maupin%22%20border&f=false 1985] and [https://www.nytimes.com/1997/05/11/magazine/border-vigilantes.html 1997] (in addition to the current 2003 kidnapping), but this doesn't come up in [https://www.montereyherald.com/2016/05/11/on-california-border-residents-scoff-at-trumps-wall/ later articles] about his border activities
*There is a [https://www.cntraveler.com/stories/2015-12-21/why-theres-a-pocket-of-britain-in-north-carolinas-outer-banks tiny piece of British land] in North Carolina
